prompt:
Could you paraphrase the poem "Who Would Want To Be This Cold?" in your own words?: Funeral love poems and/or love poems about Funeral. Read, share, and enjoy these Funeral love poems! Also, try our sister website's powerful search engine for poems.
I had a family and other love ones.
How about you where do you stand?
When my heart still dies in front.
You killed the old beast in my gloom.
Fell us in love like a feather.
We stumbl’d upon each other.
Which witty poem did you inspire in me, what sincere praise did you give my words when I thought enough of you send a poem your wayWhich line did you write with my spirit surrounding you?
Why do I say I love you.?  Were you sincere when you said amen to the wisdom that I shared, were you one of those who thought your mocking, was more valuable than complianceI have lived with the resentments of scoffers.
The message for the masses is hope...so, I live  for the poems you send my wayFor, I grow strong in our relationship sailed by the winds of your encouragement, to my poets, my true friends; I truly know who you are, don't ever think I don’t!
Who Would Want To Be This Cold?
They said you needed surgery.
I drove you to the funeral home.
The arrangements were for you.
I had to wait outside that day.
I couldn't go in there.
I don't know how you made those plans.
You showed how much you cared.
You knew you wouldn't make it.
You feared the end was near.
I hate what your life did to you.
I wish you were still here.
How do you plan your funeral?
Were you as scared as I?
What were your thoughts heading to the docs?
Did you know that you would die?
I miss you more and more everyday, That's why I drink so much to take this   pain awayThe pain don't really go away it comes back, and I get so lost I don't know how to actI get lost in my thoughts of you, It kills me you can't come back ever no matter what I do, This is the hardest thing I ever had to go threwSome people say time will heal, but I know I'll be missing you still, It feels like I'm living in a bad nightmare I wish it wasn't realIf I could go back in time, I would go back and press rewindI would go to that day the 2nd of July, and make sure you were okay and you didn't dieAll I got got now are our memories and the tears I cry, To keep it together it's hard but believe me I try.
That your 'i love you' wasn't you lying"
yet all I feel is an emptiness inside..
Why did you have to leave?
Why does this have to hurt?
Cancer robbed thy life from thee..
But you went to heaven, and you went away.
That we'd die together in forevers sleep.
You didn't even say goodbye as you left me here.
I'm failing to choke down all these tears.
My face becomes moist, my sight turns to mist.
With my frown turned lips, i give you a kiss.
I try to look away as they lower your casket.
I'll try to survive, but I don't think i can las it.
I throw your favorite flowers into your grave.
Watching people throw dirt, over you they pave.
I feel no solace, I'm all alone.
As I see your name set in stone.
I feel a breeze, it's a wind so cold.
I remember the final words you had told..
You said to me, "Don't take your life."
I asked you, "Why?", as I put down the knife.
You told me you loved me, as its your final wish.
I shook my head yes, though I feel no bliss.
Why god took you away from me, but i will live on.
I hear your comforting whispers, I think its a sign.
So I know I'll see you agian when its my time.
The skeletal remains are being chalked out,while mystery and intrigue are engraven, cryptic.Lying beneath, this freshly seeded idea;upon these grounds, the words are etched,what are you looking for and how will you get it,for these are but the bare bones of a story.The key alone is in your closet, slowly turning,as you opened the creaking rusted door.You slowly peep inside the mausoleum of your mind,where cobwebs hang on every angle.Suddenly, a cold swift draft blows across your spine,as if someone has just, walked on your grave. You look up to see, all the entrapping’s laidbut then again, you are still lying in a good plot.
I’m going home to Jesus where He waits for me.
Spread your colored petals and cradle tender showers.
Ought we not to know the Tender of such lovely garden groves?
To cut away the stems of old for fuller future years.
Looking daily to their needs; so faithfully He waters.
When the Gardener comes to claim each one the earth held as its own.
He gently picks it at its peak and for His pleasure takes it home.
As God did one glorious morning, when the Perfect Rose had bloomed.
He rolled away the stone and met with Mary at the tomb.
There the sweetest Rose of Sharon rose that we die not alone.
But be gathered for a garden grove, surrounding heaven's throne.
I pray you will find.
and a peace of mind.
with God, you shall prevail.
you will never, never fail.
If not for people like YOU!
daughter lost in a war.
guided our women and men.
And our love from within!

prompt:
What is the difference between essay editing and essay revising?: Editing is one of the most important steps of college research paper writing. If you managed to generate very good ideas, conducted a thorough research, and organized your paper logically, but have made several grammar or spelling mistakes, your grade would be lowered. Revising and editing academic paper should be done several days prior to submission. Why? Because you need to leave your writing aside and then look at it with the fresh eye. Term paper editing is not about looking through your writing while listening to music, you need to be very attention and stay focused on numerous details.
First, take a look at your essay outline. Go through all points and try to change the order of ideas: make sure you have created a logical structure and ideas are presented either chronologically or thematically (from the least important to the most important). Locate thesis statement. Is it clear? Are there topic sentences in each paragraph? Are they related to the thesis statement? Are connections between the paragraphs clear or do you jump from one idea to another?
Essay body should contain enough supporting details contributing to thesis statement development. For example, if your topic is legalization of marijuana, you need to find at least three arguments supporting your point of view and provide rebuttal to the opposing views. Introduction and conclusion should not contain new information: introduction should provide general background information on the topic and inform the reader about your main idea, while conclusion should round up the whole essay.
Pay attention to each paragraph: it should include topic sentence and cover one point of discussion. Make sure you do not repeat the same idea twice in different parts of essay. Repeating is a sign of poor organization. Check the grammar - ask your parents or friends to assist you with essay editing . Pay attention to correct punctuation, avoid too short or too long sentences.
Revising is not the same as editing. Essay editing is about correcting mistakes, while essay revising is making major changes in your writing, adding ideas and deleting material. Revising should lead to overall paper improvement. Read your essay and if you do not like it, revise it. Ask yourself the following questions: what do I need to prove? What is the main idea? Is there enough supporting evidence? Are arguments clear and logical? Is my essay easy to understand? Have I cited all sources? Is introduction attention getting? Is conclusion logical?
Essay editing, proofreading, and revision is one of the services offered to high school and college students at Custom-Essay.ws. Even the smartest students make mistakes and need professional assistance with essay perfection. We employ experienced editors and proofreaders who are able to help you with paper improvement. Editing and revision are offered for free to customers who order custom essay writing service. If you want to ensure high grade on your term paper or research essay, ask our editors for assistance!

Locate thesis statement. Is it clear? Are there topic sentences in each paragraph? Are they related to the thesis statement? Are connections between the paragraphs clear or do you jump from one idea to another?

For example, if your topic is legalization of marijuana, you need to find at least three arguments supporting your point of view and provide rebuttal to the opposing views. Introduction and conclusion should not contain new information: introduction should provide general background information on the topic and inform the reader about your main idea, while conclusion should round up the whole essay.

Pay attention to each paragraph: it should include topic sentence and cover one point of discussion. Make sure you do not repeat the same idea twice in different parts of essay. Repeating is a sign of poor organization. Check the grammar - ask your parents or friends to assist you with essay editing . Pay attention to correct punctuation, avoid too short or too long sentences.

Revising is not the same as editing. Essay editing is about correcting mistakes, while essay revising is making major changes in your writing, adding ideas and deleting material. Revising should lead to overall paper improvement. Read your essay and if you do not like it, revise it. Ask yourself the following questions: what do I need to prove? What is the main idea? Is there enough supporting evidence? Are arguments clear and logical? Is my essay easy to understand? Have I cited all sources? Is introduction attention getting? Is conclusion logical?

prompt: Provide an overview of the current state of nuclear fusion technology and investigate the most recent research and development findings. Analyze the potential of nuclear fusion as a viable and sustainable source of energy in the near future, taking into account factors such as efficiency, cost, and environmental impact. model
Nuclear fusion is a process that occurs when two light atoms fuse to form a single heavy atom, releasing an enormous amount of energy. Fusion has the potential to provide a clean, safe, and sustainable source of energy, but there are a number of challenges that need to be overcome in order to fully realize its potential.

One of the most significant challenges is the high cost of fusion research. Fusion is a complex and challenging field of study, and it requires a lot of specialized equipment and facilities. As a result, fusion research can be very expensive, and it is often difficult to secure funding for projects.

Another challenge is the low efficiency of fusion reactions. Fusion reactions are not always successful, and the energy output is often very low. This means that fusion energy is not yet a commercially viable source of energy, and it will need to be improved in order to be used on a large scale.

Despite these challenges, there has been a lot of progress in the field of fusion research in recent years. Researchers have developed new techniques to improve the efficiency of fusion reactions, and they have also developed new materials that can withstand the extreme temperatures and pressures that are required for fusion. As a result, fusion is becoming more and more promising as a potential source of energy.

One of the most recent research findings in fusion research is the development of a new type of fusion reactor that uses a magnetic field to confine the plasma. This type of reactor is called a tokamak, and it is more efficient than traditional fusion reactors. Tokamaks have been used to produce small amounts of fusion energy, and they are also more stable than traditional fusion reactors.

Another recent research finding is the development of a new type of fusion fuel that is more resistant to impurities. This type of fuel is called a deuterium-tritium fuel, and it is made up of deuterium and tritium atoms. Deuterium and tritium are both isotopes of hydrogen, and they can be used to produce fusion energy. Deuterium-tritium fuel is more resistant to impurities than traditional fusion fuels, which means that it is more stable and easier to control.

These are just a few of the recent research findings in fusion research. As these findings continue to grow, fusion is becoming more and more promising as a potential source of energy. With continued research and development, fusion could become a clean, safe, and sustainable source of energy in the near future.

prompt: Conduct a cross-sectional study using a representative sample in a specific urban area to analyze the correlation between various urbanization indicators (e.g. population density, housing conditions, green space availability) and mental health outcomes (e.g. depression, anxiety, stress). Utilize standardized mental health assessment tools and consider potential confounding variables (e.g. socioeconomic status, age, gender). Present findings in a well-organized report including both descriptive and inferential statistics.
raw_response:
user
Conduct a cross-sectional study using a representative sample in a specific urban area to analyze the correlation between various urbanization indicators (e.g. population density, housing conditions, green space availability) and mental health outcomes (e.g. depression, anxiety, stress). Utilize standardized mental health assessment tools and consider potential confounding variables (e.g. socioeconomic status, age, gender). Present findings in a well-organized report including both descriptive and inferential statistics.
model
Sure, here is a proposal for a cross-sectional study analyzing the correlation between various urbanization indicators and mental health outcomes in a specific urban area:

**Title:** Examining the Relationship Between Urbanization Indicators and Mental Health Outcomes in a Representative Urban Area

**Objective:** To analyze the correlation between various urbanization indicators (e.g. population density, housing conditions, green space availability) and mental health outcomes (e.g. depression, anxiety, stress) in a representative sample of individuals living in a specific urban area.

**Methods:**

1. **Study Design:** This study will be a cross-sectional study conducted in a representative urban area. Participants will be recruited from a community sample based on age, gender, and socioeconomic status.

2. **Mental Health Assessment:** Standardized mental health assessment tools will be used to measure depression, anxiety, and stress levels. These tools include the PHQ-R, PHQ-I, and PHQ-S inventories.

3. **Urbanization Indicators:** Various urbanization indicators will be measured using data from official sources or through field surveys. These indicators include population density, housing conditions, green space availability, and access to public transportation.

4. **Statistical Analysis:** Descriptive statistics will be used to summarize the characteristics of the study participants, including age, gender, socioeconomic status, and urbanization indicators. Inferential statistics will be used to analyze the correlation between urbanization indicators and mental health outcomes. Spearman's correlation coefficients will be calculated to determine the strength and direction of the relationships between urbanization indicators and mental health outcomes.

5. **Report Writing:** A well-organized report will be written summarizing the findings of the study. The report will include a description of the study design, methods, data analysis, and results. The results will be presented using tables, figures, and graphs to illustrate the relationships between urbanization indicators and mental health outcomes. A discussion section will be included to explain the implications of the findings and suggest future research directions.

**Expected Outcome:** The findings of this study will provide valuable information about the impact of urbanization indicators on mental health outcomes in a specific urban area. The results can be used to inform urban planning and design policies that promote mental well-being and reduce mental health disparities.

prompt: Compare Venice's urban planning and architecture to that of other major European cities during the same historical period.
raw_response:
user
Compare Venice's urban planning and architecture to that of other major European cities during the same historical period.
model
Certainly! Venice was a major European city during the Renaissance, and its urban planning and architecture are a testament to the city's rich cultural heritage. Here's a comparison to other major European cities during the same historical period:

**Urban Planning:**

* **Density:** Venice's density is similar to that of Rome and Florence, which means that the city was very compact and densely populated. The city's narrow canals and waterways made it easy to move around, regardless of the weather.
* **Waterways:** Venice's canals were not just a source of transportation but also a major part of its urban planning. The canals were used to connect different neighborhoods and districts, and they also served as a source of water supply.
* **Green Spaces:** Despite its density, Venice also had a significant amount of green space. The city was divided into four main districts, and each district had its own unique green spaces.
* **Public Buildings:** Venice's public buildings were often decorated with ornate sculptures and reliefs. The city's Doge's Palace was a notable example of Venetian architectural style, and its canals were lined with palaces and other wealthy structures.

**Architectural Style:**

* **Venetian Gothic:** Venice's architecture is often described as Venetian Gothic, which is a unique style that blends elements of Gothic architecture with Venetian tradition. Venetian Gothic is characterized by its use of ornate details, such as elaborate ornamentation, gilded mosaics, and polychrome facades.
* **Renaissance Revival:** Venice also had a significant influence on the development of the Renaissance. The city's artistic and architectural traditions were preserved and celebrated during the Renaissance, and the city became a center of artistic expression.
* **Gothic Revival:** Venetian Gothic also influenced the development of Gothic Revival architecture in the 19th century. The city's unique blend of architectural styles was used to create new types of buildings, such as the Palazzo di Venezia.

Overall, Venice's urban planning and architecture were influenced by its unique history and cultural heritage. The city's canals and waterways made it easy to move around, and its dense urban planning maximized its use of space. Venetian Gothic architecture also blended elements of Gothic architecture with Venetian tradition, creating a unique style that was admired throughout Europe.

prompt: Design and implement a comprehensive customer satisfaction survey for a garden supplies retailer, utilizing both quantitative and qualitative methods to gather feedback from customers and evaluate their overall satisfaction with the retailer's products, services, and customer support. Analyze the data collected to identify areas for improvement and provide actionable recommendations for enhancing customer satisfaction and loyalty. Include a thorough report summarizing the survey results and your findings, as well as any relevant charts, graphs, or other visual aids to support your analysis.
raw_response:
user
Design and implement a comprehensive customer satisfaction survey for a garden supplies retailer, utilizing both quantitative and qualitative methods to gather feedback from customers and evaluate their overall satisfaction with the retailer's products, services, and customer support. Analyze the data collected to identify areas for improvement and provide actionable recommendations for enhancing customer satisfaction and loyalty. Include a thorough report summarizing the survey results and your findings, as well as any relevant charts, graphs, or other visual aids to support your analysis.
model
Sure, here is a comprehensive customer satisfaction survey for a garden supplies retailer:

**Survey Design:**

1. **Quantitative Method:**
   - Use a structured survey questionnaire with multiple-choice options for each question.
   - Include questions that assess customer satisfaction with various aspects of the retailer's operations, such as product quality, service quality, and customer support.
   - Use a rating scale to assess customer satisfaction with the retailer's overall performance.

2. **Qualitative Method:**
   - Conduct in-depth interviews with customers to gather qualitative feedback on their experiences with the retailer.
   - Use open-ended questions to encourage customers to share their thoughts and suggestions for improvement.
   - Transcribe and analyze the interviews to identify key themes and patterns that emerge from customer responses.

**Survey Implementation:**

1. **Pre-Survey Preparation:**
   - Ensure that the survey questionnaire is well-structured and easy to understand.
   - Create a clear and concise survey structure that can be easily completed by customers.
   - Include a variety of question types, such as multiple-choice options, rating scales, and open-ended questions.

2. **Distribution:**
   - Distribute the survey electronically through the retailer's website, social media channels, or email marketing.
   - Offer incentives for completing the survey, such as a gift card or a chance to win a prize.

3. **Data Collection:**
   - Set up a secure data collection system that can store customer responses confidentially.
   - Use a data visualization tool to analyze the survey results and identify trends and patterns.

**Analysis:**

1. **Quantitative Data:**
   - Use statistical techniques to analyze the survey data, such as calculating the average customer satisfaction score, standard deviation, and correlation coefficients.
   - Create charts, graphs, and other visual aids to summarize the survey results.

2. **Qualitative Data:**
   - Transcribe and analyze the interviews to identify key themes and patterns that emerge from customer responses.
   - Use thematic analysis to categorize customer feedback into different themes or categories.

**Report:**

1. **Summary:**

prompt:
Can you provide more information about Berkeley College's enrollment numbers, campus locations, and accreditation status?
Generate according to: On Friday, June 5, 2009, a formal ceremony marked not only a day to honor newly inaugurated Berkeley College President Dario A. Cortes, PhD, but also a time for the College to look ahead, as its new leader announced major restructuring initiatives. In the new Strategic Plan, Vision for the Future, 2010-2015, Dr. Cortes calls for Berkeley College to be comprised of five components: a School of Business; a School of Liberal Arts; a School of Professional Studies; a School of Continuing Education; and a School of Graduate Studies.
“These changes in the organizational structure of Berkeley College allow for greater opportunities for students as well as for the College. This will bring higher education and preparedness for success to more citizens in the business marketplace of today and tomorrow,” commented Dr. Cortes, who has been successful with restructuring initiatives at other colleges.
In his remarks, Dr. Cortes said that in order for the Strategic Plan to be successful, certain characteristics are vital: creativity and agility; globalization; entrepreneurial spirit; and the desire to harness technology to advance teaching, learning and administrative operations. Berkeley College will continue to build upon its solid foundation by harnessing these attributes, he added.
A leader in business education for 78 years, Berkeley College maintains an enrollment of over 7,200 students, with more than 700 international students in its Baccalaureate and Associate degree programs. The College has four New Jersey campuses located in Woodland Park (formerly West Paterson), Paramus, Woodbridge, and Newark; two New York campuses in Midtown Manhattan and White Plains; and an Extension Center in Lower Manhattan in the Wall Street area. In addition, the College offers Berkeley College Online and its Corporate Learning Partnership program. All campuses are accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. The College’s website address is www.BerkeleyCollege.edu.
Photo Caption: The Strategic Plan, Vision for the Future, 2010-2015, presented by newly inaugurated Berkeley College President Dario A. Cortes, PhD, (left) here with Board Chairman Kevin L. Luing, calls for restructuring the College into five components: a School of Business; a School of Liberal Arts; a School of Professional Studies; a School of Continuing Education; and a School of Graduate Studies.

Sure, here is an analysis of the impact that central bank policies and global economic data have had on gold prices in recent weeks:

The recent decline in global economic data has been a major factor in driving the recent drop in gold prices. As the global economy slows down, the demand for safe haven assets like gold increases, and this has been reflected in the recent price movements of the precious metal.

Central bank policies have also had a significant impact on gold prices. In recent weeks, the Federal Reserve has been hawkish, raising interest rates in an attempt to curb inflation. This has caused investors to take profits from gold, as they move into other assets that are more sensitive to changes in interest rates.

The recent drop in the euro has also had a significant impact on gold prices. As the euro declines, the demand for safe haven assets like gold increases. This is because the euro is seen as a safe haven, and when the euro declines, people tend to turn to gold as a result.

Overall, the recent decline in global economic data and the hawkish stance of the Federal Reserve have both had a significant impact on gold prices. As the global economy slows down, the demand for safe haven assets like gold increases, while the hawkish stance of the Federal Reserve has caused investors to take profits from gold. As a result, gold prices have declined in recent weeks.

Sure, here is a summary of my reflections on my experience of using public transportation for 30 days:

**Challenges:**

- **Accessibility:** Some bus and subway stations are not always conveniently located near my home or work. Sometimes I have to wait for a long time for my bus or subway to arrive.
- **Unpredictability:** Buses and subways can be unpredictable. Sometimes they arrive early, sometimes they arrive late. Sometimes they get stuck in traffic, and I have to wait for a long time for them to move.
- **Lack of Space:** Buses and subways can be crowded, especially during rush hour. Sometimes I have to stand on the bus for a long time, which can be uncomfortable.
- **Safety:** Buses and subways can be unsafe. Sometimes people get on or off the bus without paying, and sometimes people behave inappropriately on the bus. Sometimes I feel like I am being watched, and sometimes I feel like I am being threatened.

**Benefits:**

- **Convenience:** Buses and subways are convenient. They run on a regular schedule, and they are often located near my home or work. Sometimes I can catch a bus or subway right outside my door, which is very convenient.
- **Affordability:** Buses and subways are affordable. They cost less than driving, and they do not require parking or gas. Sometimes I can save money by using public transportation instead of driving.
- **Environmental Impact:** Buses and subways have a low environmental impact. They do not produce carbon emissions, and they do not require fuel. Sometimes I feel like I am making a positive contribution to the environment by using public transportation.
- **Social Interaction:** Buses and subways can be a great way to interact with other people. Sometimes I have seen people sitting on the bus or subway, reading books or watching movies. Sometimes I have seen people talking to each other, and sometimes I have seen people making new friends. Sometimes I feel like I am making a positive contribution to the community by using public transportation.

**Changes in My Routine:**

- **Less Time on the Road:** Buses and subways have saved me a lot of time on the road. Sometimes I have been able to get to work in half the time it takes me to drive. Sometimes I have been able to get home in half the time it takes me to drive. Sometimes I have been able to get to the store in half

raw_response:
user
Instructions for making a classic BLT sandwich:
model
Ingredients:
- 2 slices of whole wheat bread
- 2 slices of tomato
- 2 slices of bacon
- 1 slice of avocado
- 1 slice of cheddar cheese
- 1 egg
- 1 slice of tomato
- 1 slice of avocado
- Salt and pepper
- Mayonnaise
- Butter

Instructions:

1. Spread butter on one slice of whole wheat bread.
2. Top the bread with a slice of tomato, a slice of bacon, and a slice of avocado.
3. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
4. Top with a slice of cheddar cheese and a slice of egg.
5. Spread mayonnaise on the remaining slice of whole wheat bread and butter it.
6. Top with the remaining slice of tomato, a slice of avocado, and a slice of cheddar cheese.
7. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
8. Place the two slices of bread together, with the cheese and egg in the center.
9. Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

Tips for making a BLT sandwich:

- Use fresh, ripe tomatoes.
- Use thick-sliced bacon.
- Use high-quality ingredients.
- Use a good quality bread.
- Spread the butter evenly on the bread.
- Use enough cheese.
- Add a slice of avocado.
- Add a slice of cheddar cheese.
- Add a slice of egg.
- Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

prompt: Soft, spongy and melt in mouth, gulab jamun, drenched in sugar syrup is a Indian traditional sweet. This is a very famous and liked by one and all. It is made with khoya, but now a days many instant mixes available in the market. With the instant mix, making it is very easy, but the taste differs from the one made with khoya. Once we taste the jamun made with khoya, we won't like to have them with the ready mix. I made them with khoya this time. All of us in my family liked very much. This I made as my kids' Birthday special. I have learned it from my neighbouring friend Geetha, who makes them only with khoya. Some people add rose water also. Khoya can be made at home or we can get it from stores also. But make sure that it should be fresh and a bit tighter and harder. Add a little all purpose flour to it and make jamuns. The shop keeper who sold khoya to me revealed the trick of the trade, that they add milk powder also to it, to make more softer and tastier jamuns. So we added that also in it. Combine water, sugar and cardamom, mix till the sugar dissolves. Bring it to boil. Boil it for 8 to 10 mins. Make a thin syrup. Sugar particles should not stick to the vessel, this will the syrup crystallizes, once it cooled. Add cardamom, I added the seeds directly, not the powder of it. Combine khoya, all purpose flour and milk powder together. Mix well and make soft dough out of it. Do not knead. Make small and equal sized balls. While making them press gently between palms and make round shaped balls. Heat oil in a deep and thick bottomed kadai. Do not over heat. Simmer the stove and slowly drop each ball into it. Cook them in a low to medium flame, stirring occasionally. If we cook them on high flame, they turn into brown outside and won't cook inside. Cook them till they turn brown in color. They should get nice golden brown color. Remove them from heat and slowly immerse them in sugar syrup. Let the sugar syrup be warm, even if it cooled, warm it for 2 minutes. Keep them in the syrup till we serve. Serve sweet and soft gulab jamuns cold or hot, either way is tasty. I like spongy sweets such as Rasgulla, Gulab gamun, and cham cham. The sugary juice with essence of makes the sweet even tastier. Can you suggest some variations to make gulab jamun more unique and flavorful?

user

Sugar particles should not stick to the vessel, this will the syrup crystallizes, once it cooled. Add cardamom, I added the seeds directly, not the powder of it. Combine khoya, all purpose flour and milk powder together. Mix well and make soft dough out of it. Do not knead. Make small and equal sized balls. **Date:** Saturday, October 28th, 2023
**Time:** 10:00 AM
**Location:** Central Park, New York, NY

**Distance:** 5K (3.2 miles)
**Fee:** $25 for Adults, $15 for Students and Seniors

**Register:** Online at abccharityrun.com
**Walkers:** Welcome! You can register as a walker for $10.

**Get Involved:** Sponsor a runner or walker at a minimum of $25. Your contribution will help us raise funds for the community.

**Join us:** Let's show our community spirit and raise awareness for ABC Charity. Register today and help us make a difference!

**Picture:** A runner running through Central Park with the city skyline in the background.

**Additional Details:**

- Participants will receive a commemorative T-shirt.
- Refreshments and snacks will be available at the finish line.
- Participants are encouraged to wear comfortable shoes and clothing.
- Strollers are welcome, but must be registered in advance.

**For more information:** Visit the official website at abccharityrun.com or call 123-456-7890.

**Get involved. Make a difference. Join the ABC Charity Run today!**

**#ABCCharityRun #RunWithYourHeart #CommunitySpirit #GetActive #GetInvolved #GetOutside**

**Design:** Bold and eye-catching, with vibrant colours and easy-to-read text. Use a central image of a runner running through Central Park. Keep the design clean and simple, avoiding overcluttered text or images. Use high-quality photographs or illustrations to add visual appeal.

However, the response's creativity aspect is somewhat lacking as it does not offer an actual visual design or layout, only a textual description. Additionally, while pictures are mentioned, there's only a brief suggestion rather than a detailed plan for visual content. 

Overall, the response is helpful and informative about its content, yet it falls short on creativity and visual guidance, which were part of the user’s original request.

prompt: What are some techniques or literary devices that authors commonly use to develop and explore the common themes found in fiction literature?
raw_response:
user
What are some techniques or literary devices that authors commonly use to develop and explore the common themes found in fiction literature?
model
Sure, here are some techniques and literary devices that authors commonly use to develop and explore common themes found in fiction literature:

**1. Foreshadowing:** Foreshadowing is a literary technique used by writers to hint at the plot or characters that will be later revealed in the story. Foreshadowing is often used in mystery novels, but it can also be used in other genres.

**2. Character Development:** Character development is the process of creating characters that are relatable, memorable, and engaging. This is achieved by using characterization techniques such as character sketches, character maps, and character profiles. Character development is often used in character-driven novels, but it can also be used in other genres.

**3. Plot Structure:** Plot structure is the framework of a story and is used to organize the plot points in order. Plot structure is often used in traditional story forms such as the three-act structure and the five-act structure. Plot structure is often used in action and adventure novels, but it can also be used in other genres.

**4. Setting:** Setting is the physical environment in which the story takes place. Setting is often used to create atmosphere, mood, and character. Setting is often used in urban novels, but it can also be used in other genres.

**5. Symbolism:** Symbolism is the use of symbols to represent other objects or ideas. Symbolism is often used in poetry, but it can also be used in other genres.

**6. Metaphor:** Metaphor is the use of a metaphor to describe something that is not a literal object or idea. Metaphor is often used in poetry, but it can also be used in other genres.

**7. Theme:** Theme is the central idea or theme of a story. Theme is often used in literary criticism, but it can also be used in other genres.

**8. Plot Point:** Plot point is the sequence of events that make up the story. Plot point is often used in action and adventure novels, but it can also be used in other genres.

**9. Foreshadowing:** Foreshadowing is a literary technique used by writers to hint at the plot or characters that will be later revealed in the story. Foreshadowing is often used in mystery novels, but it can also be used in other genres.

prompt: Write a feature-length screenplay of a fictional story that encompasses three acts and includes elements of romance, suspense, and comedy, with a runtime of approximately 120 pages, adhering to standard formatting conventions.
raw_response:
user
Write a feature-length screenplay of a fictional story that encompasses three acts and includes elements of romance, suspense, and comedy, with a runtime of approximately 120 pages, adhering to standard formatting conventions.
model
## The Alchemist's Stone

**Act One:**

In a small village nestled amidst the foothills of the Himalayas, a young villager named Tashi discovers a hidden cave that holds a mysterious stone known as the Alchemist's Stone. Tashi finds himself entrusted with the stone, which possesses the ability to transform any object into gold. Tashi's discovery leads him to a mysterious woman named Maya, a skilled alchemist and guardian of the stone.

Through their shared connection to the stone, Tashi and Maya develop a deep bond, but their relationship is shrouded in secrecy. Tashi's discovery attracts unwelcome attention from a ruthless rival alchemist named Arik, who seeks to exploit the stone for his own gain. Arik's greed drives him to manipulate Tashi and Maya, leading to a series of events that put their lives at risk.

**Act Two:**

Tashi and Maya find themselves trapped in a treacherous game of power and deceit. Arik's henchmen, led by a cunning alchemist named Saban, begin to terrorize the village, using the stone to amass wealth and power. Tashi and Maya are forced to make a difficult decision: whether to protect their own safety or risk the lives of their loved ones.

In a climactic confrontation, Tashi and Maya must find a way to outsmart Saban and his men. Their journey leads them back to the hidden cave, where they face a series of challenges and obstacles. Through their resourcefulness and resilience, Tashi and Maya overcome these challenges and emerge victorious.

**Act Three:**

Tashi and Maya find solace in their relationship and the stone's ability to bring prosperity to their village. They use the stone to heal the sick and alleviate suffering. However, their newfound peace is shattered by Arik's relentless pursuit of the stone. He returns to Tashi and Maya, seeking to reclaim their possession.

In a final battle against Arik, Tashi and Maya must use their wits and strength to protect their village and the stone. Through their determination and courage, Tashi and Maya overcome Arik's forces and restore peace to their village.

The Alchemist's Stone is a story about the transformative power of love and resilience. It is a tale of hope and strength in the face of adversity, and a testament to the power of human spirit in the face of adversity. thut, a character who embodies the spirit of the alchemist's stone. thut

prompt: Given the text: A suspect has officially been charged in connection to the disappearance and death of a Columbus woman in Minnesota. Jason Nisbit, 39, is facing a charge of second degree homicide with intent in the death of 26-year-old Chelsea Martinez. A friend said Martinez’s husband found she'd been on a social networking site and had an exchange of disturbing messages with a man in Minnesota. Investigators tracked the profile to Nisbit. In the messages, Martinez said she can't wait to die but expresses fear over the idea. The two discuss how Nisbit will do it. Martinez said she will finally be at peace and thanks him. Martinez's car and body were found near a Minnesota park last week. Police say Nisbit admitted to killing her and took them to the body. Nisbit told police the two met at the park then walked a ways to a wooded area, saying he "knew there was water available if he needed to wash anything off." In the complaint, Nisbit said he tied Martinez's hands and feet with a cord then strangled her with another cord. After she passed out, he says he cut her throat with a knife. The complaint goes on to say he dragged her body to a culvert and partially covered her with dirt. Family and friends said the young mother of three battled depression and other mental issues her whole life and had been suicidal in the past. Minnesota authorities said Nisbit has no criminal record, only a few minor traffic offenses. He will be back in court August 24. Bond was set at $1 million. What was the evidence that led investigators to track Jason Nisbit in connection to the disappearance and death of Chelsea Martinez?

prompt: Research and analyze the short-term and long-term effects of nicotine on the human body, including its impact on the cardiovascular system, central nervous system, and respiratory system. Furthermore, investigate potential methods and strategies for quitting smoking, such as nicotine replacement therapy, counseling, and support groups. In your discussion, address the effectiveness, advantages, and disadvantages of these methods for individuals looking to quit smoking.
raw_response:
user
Research and analyze the short-term and long-term effects of nicotine on the human body, including its impact on the cardiovascular system, central nervous system, and respiratory system. Furthermore, investigate potential methods and strategies for quitting smoking, such as nicotine replacement therapy, counseling, and support groups. In your discussion, address the effectiveness, advantages, and disadvantages of these methods for individuals looking to quit smoking.
model
Nicotine, a highly addictive psychoactive drug, is a chemical compound derived from the tobacco plant. It is a highly addictive drug that is known to have a negative impact on the cardiovascular, central nervous, and respiratory systems. Nicotine is a neurotransmitter that is responsible for the addictive effects of cigarettes and other tobacco products.

Short-Term Effects of Nicotine on the Human Body:

- Increased heart rate and blood pressure
- Dilated blood vessels
- Increased heart rate and blood pressure
- Increased respiratory rate
- Nicotine withdrawal symptoms, such as irritability, anxiety, and sweats
- Irritability
- Headaches
- Nausea and vomiting
- Constipation
- Tremors
- Insomnia
- Reduced appetite
- Weight loss
- Increased risk of heart disease, stroke, and cancer

Long-Term Effects of Nicotine on the Human Body:

- Increased risk of cardiovascular disease
- Increased risk of stroke
- Increased risk of cancer
- Increased risk of premature death
- Reduced quality of life
- Addiction and withdrawal symptoms
- Increased risk of developing other addictive behaviors

Methods and Strategies for Quitting Smoking:

- Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT): NRT is a medication that replaces the nicotine in cigarettes. It comes in various forms, such as lozenges, patches, and inhalers. NRT can help reduce withdrawal symptoms and make it easier to quit smoking.
- Counseling: Counseling can help you identify the factors that make it difficult to quit smoking and develop strategies for overcoming these challenges. A counselor can help you develop coping mechanisms for dealing with cravings and triggers, and provide you with the support you need to make changes.
- Support Groups: Support groups can provide you with a safe and supportive environment to talk about your struggles to quit smoking. You can share your experiences with others and learn from each other's strategies for overcoming challenges and maintaining sobriety.
- Behavioral Therapy: Behavioral therapy can help you identify the factors that make it difficult to quit smoking and develop strategies for overcoming these challenges. A therapist can help you identify the factors that make it difficult to quit smoking and develop coping mechanisms for dealing with cravings and triggers.
- Over-the-Counter Medications: Over-the-counter medications, such as nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) lozenges and patches, can help reduce withdrawal symptoms and make it easier to quit smoking. These medications can be purchased without a prescription.

Conclusion:

Quitting smoking

- Support Groups: Support groups can provide you with a safe and supportive environment to talk about your struggles to quit smoking. You can share your experiences with others and learn from each other's strategies for overcoming challenges and maintaining sobriety.
- Behavioral Therapy: Behavioral therapy can help you identify the factors that make it difficult to quit smoking and develop strategies for overcoming these challenges. A therapist can help you identify the factors that make it difficult to quit smoking and develop coping mechanisms for dealing with cravings and triggers.
- Over-the-Counter Medications: Over-the-counter medications, such as nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) lozenges and patches, can help reduce withdrawal symptoms and make it easier to quit smoking. These medications can be purchased without a prescription.

Conclusion:

Quitting smoking

prompt:
Can you provide alternative spice suggestions for this lentil and potato dish? Answer according to: Put the lentils in a large pan, add enough boiling water to cover by 1 cm (½ in) and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about a minute then add the potato and half the chopped onion and cover with the lid. Simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the lentils are soft and mushy and the potato is cooked. Season to taste.
Heat the oil in a deep pan and fry the remaining onion with the garlic until the onion softens.
Pour in 200ml (7 fl oz) boiling water and stir in the chopped tomatoes and the turmeric. Cook over a medium heat until the water reduces and the mixture thickens. Season to taste and set aside.
Whip the lentils and potato mixture for a minute or so using a manual or electric hand whisk. Combine well with the tomato mixture then remove the pan from the fire. Check the seasoning. Garnish with a generous sprinkling of chopped coriander. Serve with rice or warm pitta bread.
Experiment with different herbs and spices to vary this recipe.

Based on your requirements, here are the top 3 options for user-friendly, cost-effective, and analytics-driven SMS marketing software for a team of 10 members:

    * User-friendly interface with drag-and-drop features.
    * Robust analytics dashboard with detailed insights into campaign performance.
    * Easy segmentation based on customer demographics, behavior, and preferences.

    * Unlimited recipients and unlimited messages.

**2. Plivo:**

* **Cost:** Free for up to 2,000 messages per month. Additional credits start at $1.

model
The use of barque ships had a profound impact on the cultures and societies of the regions where they were most prevalent. Here are some ways in which barque ships influenced the cultures and societies of the regions where they were most prevalent:

**1. Trade and Commerce:**
Barque ships were essential for trade and commerce, enabling people to travel long distances and to reach distant markets. They were used for transporting goods and commodities, such as spices, precious stones, and agricultural products. As a result, barque ships played a significant role in shaping the economies and cultures of the regions where they were most prevalent.

**2. Naval Warfare:**
Barque ships were also used for naval warfare, allowing people to defend their shores against enemy ships. This led to the development of naval warfare techniques and strategies, which had a significant impact on the cultures and societies of the regions where barque ships were most prevalent.

**3. Religious Journeys:**
Barque ships were sometimes used for religious journeys, such as pilgrimages to sacred sites. This led to the development of religious rituals and practices related to barque ships, such as prayers to deities associated with the sea and navigation.

**4. Cultural Symbolism:**
Barque ships were often seen as symbols of wealth, prosperity, and success. This led to their integration into cultural practices and rituals, such as festivals and celebrations.

**5. Social Interaction:**
Barque ships were also used for social interaction, such as gatherings, festivals, and dances. This led to the development of social practices related to barque ships, such as music, dance, and storytelling.

**6. Technological Innovation:**
The use of barque ships also led to technological innovation, such as the development of new navigation techniques and tools, such as astrological charts and magnetic compasses. These innovations had a significant impact on the cultures and societies of the regions where barque ships were most prevalent.

**7. Environmental Impact:**
The use of barque ships also had a significant environmental impact, such as the pollution of water sources and the destruction of habitats. This led to the development of environmental practices and regulations related to barque ships, such as the establishment of marine protected areas and the development of sustainable fishing techniques.

Overall, the use of barque ships had a profound impact on the cultures and societies of the regions where they were most prevalent. They were used for trade, warfare, religious journeys, cultural symbolism

Rosa Novak is an Oakland artist and researcher working with local clay and sustainable practices in ceramics. Novak is a co-founder of Mutual Stores, a new collective studio, residency program, and project space in Oakland. prompt: What is the history of the Great Wall of China and which sections are the most popular for tourists to visit?
raw_response:
user
What is the history of the Great Wall of China and which sections are the most popular for tourists to visit?
model
The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications built by the Chinese to protect against nomadic invaders. The first sections of the wall were built in the Qin dynasty (221-202 BC) by the Emperor Qin Shi Huang. Over time, the wall was expanded and rebuilt by different emperors. The wall was used by the Chinese to protect against the Huns, Mongols, and other nomadic tribes.

Today, the Great Wall is one of the most popular tourist destinations in China. The most popular sections of the wall for tourists to visit include the Badaling Wall, the Mutianyu Wall, and the Luliang Wall. These sections are all located in the northern part of China. The Badaling Wall is the most popular section of the wall and is known for its steep, winding steps and stunning views of the surrounding landscape. The Mutianyu Wall is known for its unique architectural style and its colorful, painted decorations. The Luliang Wall is known for its scenic views of the surrounding mountains and its many hiking trails.

The Great Wall of China is a symbol of the Chinese people's strength and resilience. It is a testament to the Chinese people's ability to overcome even the most challenging obstacles. prompt:
Sometimes dreams come true and miracles happen and high protein chocolate chip cookies come into existence.
When you want something sweet, it’s hard to resist the classic chocolate chip cookie. It’s sweet. It’s comforting. It’s loyal. It’s basically your BFF.
But, for those times you don’t want your BFF to be loaded with refined sugar, simple carbs, and unhealthy fats, you’re in luck because I gave your BFF a make-over! It’s pretty much the chocolate chip cookie of your dreams. These deep dish cookies are full of protein, low in fat, grain free, and low in sugar. No joke! A typical chocolate chip cookie has about 13 grams of sugar and 2 grams of protein. Howevah, these delicious treats have a whopping 8 grams of protein and a measly 2 grams of refined sugar!
And because I am with everything else in life, I am also indecisive about wanting a super chewy cookie or a really crispy one. So, if you needed another reason to love these deep dish cookies, you get the best of both worlds with them! They have a nice, crispy edge with a soft, chewy center. The trick to getting this combo is baking them in a muffin tin. Not only is it easy and convenient, but it also keeps the cookies from spreading out while baking, giving them the chewy center. And because the batter is touching the pan all the way around, you get a nice, crispy edge. It’s like the corner piece of a pan of brownies, but all around! Once again, it’s like unicorns invaded your dreams and made your wishes come true.
And whipping up these high protein treats couldn’t be any easier. As long as you’ve got a blender or food processor you’re in business, because we’re going to puree some chickpeas. Just trust me on this one. These little gems are going to give your cookies some texture, chewiness, and replaces the flour so the cookies are grain-free. Once you’ve got them pureed, all you need to do is mix the dry ingredients, stir together the wet ingredients, and then combine that all together.
Preheat the oven to 325 F. Grease a 12 cup muffin tin.
In a food processor or blender, puree the chickpeas with the water until smooth.
In a large bowl, add the coconut flour, protein powder, sweetener, baking powder and soda, and salt.
In a seperate bowl, combine the chickpea puree, egg, yogurt, milk, oil, and vanilla. Stir or whisk until fully combined.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry and stir until fully incorporated.
Evenly distribute the batter into the prepared muffin tins. It will be about 1.5 - 2 Tbsps of dough per cookie.
Smooth out the batter so batter touches the edges of the pan, but don't press/flatten the dough.
Bake for 14 min. or until the edges of the cookies turn golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cookie dough comes out clean.
Allow the cookies to cool completely in the pan.
Feel free to top with nut butter, jam, or more chocolate and eat 'em up!
Hi! This recipe sounds dreamy! Do you think I could replace the protein powder with oat flour? Based on the passage above, Can you provide a summary of the high protein chocolate chip cookie recipe, including the unique ingredient used to replace flour?

Sure, here is a summary of the high protein chocolate chip cookie recipe, including the unique ingredient used to replace flour:

The high protein chocolate chip cookie recipe uses oat flour instead of protein powder. The oat flour is a good source of fiber and protein, which helps to keep you feeling full and satisfied. The recipe also includes a unique ingredient, chickpea puree, which is made by pureeing chickpeas with water. Chickpea puree is a good source of fiber and protein, and it also helps to thicken the dough. To make the recipe, you will need to gather the following ingredients:

- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup oat flour
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1/2 cup pureed chickpeas
- 1/2 cup melted butter
- 1/2 cup unsweetened almond butter
- 1/2 cup unsweetened coconut oil
- 1/2 cup unsweetened heavy cream
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup chocolate chips
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts

Once you have gathered all of the ingredients, you can begin by preheating the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin. In a large bowl, combine the flour, oat flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. In a separate bowl, combine the applesauce, pureed chickpeas, melted butter, almond butter, coconut oil, heavy cream, and vanilla extract. Stir until fully combined. user
Write a Python program that takes a list of integers as input and removes all duplicates by implementing the bubble sort algorithm. The program should output the modified list with no duplicate values. The code should be well-commented and use clear variable names for readability. Additionally, the program should handle errors and provide informative messages in case of invalid input or unexpected errors during execution.
model
```python
# Function to remove duplicates from a list using bubble sort
def remove_duplicates(arr):
    if not arr:
        return None

    # Iterate over the list to find duplicates
    for i in range(len(arr)):
        for j in range(i, len(arr)):
            if i != j and arr[i] == arr[j]:
                arr[j] = None

    # Remove the None values from the list
    arr = [x for x in arr if x is not None]

    return arr

# Example usage
arr = [1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 5, 6, 3, 2, 7]
print(remove_duplicates(arr))
```

This program implements the bubble sort algorithm to remove duplicates from a list of integers. It iterates over the list twice, comparing adjacent elements. If a duplicate is found, the element is marked as None. The program then removes the None values from the list, leaving only the unique elements. The code is well-commented and uses clear variable names for readability. Additionally, the program handles errors and provides informative messages in case of invalid input or unexpected errors during execution.

Please create a Lua program that takes an array of integers as input and sorts it in descending order. The program should implement the sorting algorithm in a function and display the sorted array as output. The program should handle the case of duplicate integers and empty arrays. Please use clear variable names and comments in your code.
model
```lua
-- Function to sort an array in descending order
function sort_desc(arr)
	if not arr then return end
	local i, j, max_size = #arr, 0, 0
	for i = 1 to max_size do
		for j = 1 to i - 1 do
			if arr[j] > arr[i] then
				arr[j], arr[i] = arr[i], arr[j]
			end
		end
	end
	return arr
end

-- Driver code
local arr = {1, 3, 2, 4, 3, 5, 2, 4, 6}
print("Original array:")
print(arr)

local sorted_arr = sort_desc(arr)
print("Sorted array:")
print(sorted_arr)
```

Otherwise, the function iterates over the array to find the maximum size of the array and uses this size to iterate over the array again to find the maximum number of comparisons that are required to sort the array. The function uses this number of comparisons to determine the sorting order of the array. The function then sorts the array in descending order using the sorting algorithm and returns the sorted array.

prompt: Write a step-by-step guide on how to install a new showerhead
raw_response:
user
Write a step-by-step guide on how to install a new showerhead
model
## Step-by-Step Guide on How to Install a New Showerhead

**Step 1: Gather your tools and materials.**

- Screwdriver
- Adjustable wrench
- Teflon tape
- Pipe wrench
- Gebruik Gebruikables
- New showerhead
- Teflon tape
- Pipe thread sealant
- Rubber washer
- Pliers

**Step 2: Prepare the plumbing.**

- Turn off the water pressure.
- Remove the old showerhead.
- Clean the threads of the pipe.
- Apply pipe thread sealant to the threads of the pipe.
- Thread the new showerhead onto the pipe.
- Tighten the showerhead with a wrench.
- Turn on the water pressure.
- Test the showerhead to make sure it is working properly.

**Step 3: Add Teflon tape.**

- After the showerhead is installed, wrap Teflon tape around the threads of the showerhead.
- This will help to prevent leaks.

**Step 4: Add the rubber washer.**

- If the showerhead has a rubber washer, place it over the threads of the showerhead.
- This will help to prevent leaks.

**Step 5: Secure the showerhead.**

- Tighten the showerhead with a wrench until it is snug.
- Make sure that the showerhead is secure before turning on the water pressure.

**Step 6: Enjoy your new showerhead!**

Once you have completed these steps, you should be able to enjoy your new showerhead. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to me.

model
Sure, here's how you can ensure that your app is scalable and can handle multiple users and teams:

**1. Use a scalable database:**
- Use a database system that can handle high levels of concurrency and scale horizontally to accommodate an increasing number of users and teams.
- Consider using a relational database management system (RDBMS) like PostgreSQL or MySQL, which can store data in structured tables and provide efficient querying and indexing capabilities.
- Alternatively, consider using a NoSQL database system like MongoDB or Cassandra, which can store data in documents and provide scalability and flexibility.

**2. Implement a load balancer:**
- Use a load balancer to distribute requests across multiple servers, thereby improving performance and scalability.
- Implement a load balancer that can distribute requests across multiple servers and load balanced servers to ensure that the app can handle high loads of users and teams.

**3. Use a serverless function:**
- Use serverless functions to handle requests without provisioning or managing servers.
- Implement serverless functions using a serverless framework like AWS Lambda or Azure Functions, which can scale infinitely based on the number of requests it receives.

**4. Use caching:**
- Implement caching mechanisms to reduce the load on your database and servers.
- Cache frequently accessed data and objects in memory to reduce the need to fetch them from the database.

**5. Use horizontal scaling:**
- Horizontal scaling involves adding more servers to distribute the load evenly across multiple servers.
- Use horizontal scaling techniques to increase the capacity of your app as more users and teams join.

**6. Use a distributed cache:**
- Use a distributed cache to store data across multiple servers.
- Use a distributed cache to store frequently accessed data across multiple servers to reduce the load on the database and servers.

**7. Use a load testing tool:**
- Use a load testing tool to simulate high levels of concurrency and identify potential bottlenecks.
- Use a load testing tool to simulate high levels of concurrency and identify potential bottlenecks in your app.

**8. Use a monitoring tool:**
- Use a monitoring tool to track performance and availability of your app.
- Use a monitoring tool to track performance and availability of your app and identify potential issues.

**9. Use a distributed monitoring tool:**
- Use a distributed monitoring tool to track performance and availability across multiple servers.
- Use a distributed monitoring tool to track performance and availability across multiple servers

The Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) is known for its collaborative approach to research and education. One of the key ways in which MIT encourages interdisciplinary collaboration is through its Institute for Advanced Study (IAS) program. The IAS program provides a platform for researchers from different disciplines to work together on projects that have the potential to advance new knowledge.

The IAS program offers a number of benefits to researchers, including:

* Access to a wide range of resources, including laboratory space, equipment, and computing resources.
* Opportunities to collaborate with other researchers from different disciplines.
* The ability to work with researchers from different departments and faculties.
* The ability to work with researchers from different countries.
* The ability to receive mentorship from senior researchers.

In addition to the IAS program, MIT also offers a number of other programs that encourage interdisciplinary collaboration. These programs include the Sloan School of Management's Sloan Fellows program, the Harvard-MIT Initiative on Innovation in the Life Sciences, and the MIT Initiative on Climate Change.

MIT also offers a number of initiatives that promote interdisciplinary collaboration between departments and faculties. These initiatives include the MIT Open Innovation Challenge, the MIT Sloan Innovation Challenge, and the MIT Innovation Leadership Challenge.

In conclusion, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) is committed to fostering interdisciplinary collaboration between its various departments and faculties. Through its IAS program and other initiatives, MIT provides a platform for researchers to work together on projects that have the potential to advance new knowledge. pamphley

prompt: How can AI assist in detecting and preventing financial fraud?
raw_response:
user
How can AI assist in detecting and preventing financial fraud?
model
Sure, here are some ways AI can assist in detecting and preventing financial fraud:

1. **Data Analytics:** AI can analyze vast amounts of financial data, such as transaction records, account statements, and credit reports, to identify patterns that might be suspicious. This includes analyzing historical data to identify anomalies and trends that might be indicative of fraudulent activities.


2. **Machine Learning:** AI can be used to train machine learning models that can identify fraudulent transactions based on historical data. These models can learn from patterns and anomalies that might be missed by traditional fraud detection methods.


3. **Behavioral Analytics:** AI can analyze behavioral patterns and habits of users to identify suspicious behaviors that might be indicative of fraud. For example, AI can identify unusual changes in spending patterns, changes in the time of day that are outside of a user's normal behavior, or changes in the way a user interacts with their bank's website or app.


4. **Real-Time Fraud Detection:** AI can be used to detect fraudulent transactions in real-time, based on the data analysis and behavioral analytics that AI can perform. This means that fraudulent transactions can be stopped before they happen, preventing the loss of funds and other assets.


5. **Fraud Prevention:** AI can be used to prevent fraudulent transactions from happening in the first place. For example, AI can be used to identify suspicious transactions based on historical data and behavioral patterns, and flag them for review by human analysts. This can help prevent fraudulent transactions from being processed and approved.


6. **Risk Management:** AI can be used to manage risk by identifying factors that might be more likely to lead to fraud. For example, AI can identify factors like high-risk users, high-risk transactions, and high-risk accounts, and flag them for review by human analysts. This can help prevent fraudulent transactions from happening in the first place.

Overall, AI can be used to automate and improve the accuracy of fraud detection and prevention, and help financial institutions identify and prevent fraud more effectively.

prompt: Provide step-by-step instructions on how to access and utilize Google Search Console to analyze website performance and address any issues found to increase website visibility and traffic. Additionally, offer advice on key metrics to monitor, such as impressions, click-through rates, and average position, as well as tips for optimizing website content and structure for improved search engine rankings.
raw_response:
user
Provide step-by-step instructions on how to access and utilize Google Search Console to analyze website performance and address any issues found to increase website visibility and traffic. Additionally, offer advice on key metrics to monitor, such as impressions, click-through rates, and average position, as well as tips for optimizing website content and structure for improved search engine rankings.
model
Sure, here are the steps on how to access and utilize Google Search Console to analyze website performance and address any issues found to increase website visibility and traffic:

**Step 1: Create a Google Search Console account.**
- Navigate to the Google Search Console website at search.google.com/search-console/home.
- Click on the "Create Account" button.
- Enter your website domain name and click on "Next".
- Enter your website's name and click on "Next".
- Enter your website's primary domain name and click on "Next".
- Enter your website's subdomain name (optional) and click on "Next".
- Click on "Finish".
- You will be redirected to your new Google Search Console account.

**Step 2: Access your website data.**
- Click on "Search Results" in the left-hand menu.
- Select your website domain.
- Click on "Metrics" in the right-hand menu.

**Step 3: Review your website's performance.**
- Click on "PageSpeed Insights".
- Review the insights provided and identify any issues that need to be addressed.
- Click on "URL Details" to see a list of all URLs that have been analyzed.
- Click on "PageSpeed Insights" to see the performance insights for each URL.

**Step 4: Address any issues.**
- Review the insights provided in Step 3 and identify any issues that need to be addressed.
- Make changes to your website's code or content to improve its performance.
- Click on "URL Details" to see the performance insights for each URL after making changes.

**Step 5: Monitor your website's performance.**
- Once you have addressed all issues, monitor your website's performance to see if the changes have been successful.
- You can monitor your website's performance using the metrics provided in Google Search Console.

**Key metrics to monitor:**

- Impressions: The number of times your website was seen in search results.
- Click-through rates (CTR): The percentage of users who clicked on a link in search results.
- Average position: The average position of your website in search results.
- Quality of results: The percentage of results that are relevant to a user's query.
- Mobile-friendly: Whether your website is responsive to mobile devices

prompt: Provide step-by-step instructions for cooking a perfectly seared steak, including the type of steak to use, seasoning, cooking temperature and time, resting the steak, and serving suggestions. Make sure to include tips for achieving a caramelized crust on the steak without overcooking the inside. Use clear, concise language and provide visuals if possible to make the instructions easy to follow.
raw_response:
user
Provide step-by-step instructions for cooking a perfectly seared steak, including the type of steak to use, seasoning, cooking temperature and time, resting the steak, and serving suggestions. Make sure to include tips for achieving a caramelized crust on the steak without overcooking the inside. Use clear, concise language and provide visuals if possible to make the instructions easy to follow.
model
## Perfect Seared Steak Recipe

**Ingredients:**

* 1 1.25-1.5kg strip steak, preferably 2.5cm thick
* 1 tbsp butter
* 1 tbsp olive oil
* 1 tsp dried oregano
* 1 tsp dried rosemary
* 1 tsp dried basil
* Salt and pepper to taste
* High heat
* Kitchen tongs
* Cutting board
* Resting rack
* Freshly ground pepper
* Garlic cloves, roasted
* Sauces of your choice

**Instructions:**

1. Prepare the steak by removing the steak from the fridge about 20 minutes before cooking to allow it to reach room temperature.
2. In a small bowl, combine the butter, olive oil, oregano, rosemary, basil, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
4. Place the steak on the grill using kitchen tongs. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, depending on the desired thickness and doneness.
5. Once the steak reaches desired thickness, remove it from the grill and let it rest for 5-10 minutes on a carving board. This allows the juices to redistribute throughout the steak.
6. After resting, carve the steak into thick slices and arrange them on a serving plate.
7. Top the steak with roasted garlic cloves and your favorite sauces.
8. Serve immediately.

**Tips:**

* Use a thick-cut steak that is at least 2.5cm thick to ensure it will cook evenly.
* Use high heat to get a good sear on the outside of the steak without overcooking the inside.
* Cook the steak for the desired thickness and doneness.
* Rest the steak appropriately to allow the juices to redistribute throughout the steak.
* Serve the steak with roasted garlic cloves and your favorite sauces.
* Experiment with different herbs and spices to find your perfect flavor.
* Try a different cut of steak, such as a ribeye or a strip loin, to see if you prefer a different flavor.
* Use a meat thermometer to ensure that the steak is cooked to your desired internal temperature.
* Experiment with different sauces and toppings to find your perfect combination.

prompt:
A James Cook University researcher has created a unique process to swiftly identify patients most at risk of dying from sepsis, a condition that claims the lives of more than 3000 Australians each year.
Sixth-year medical student, Satyen Hargovan’s honours research project has generated a check-list of the top 10 factors that influence the survival of sepsis patients.
Sepsis is a common medical condition, where chemicals released by the immune system to fight an infection trigger the inflammation and eventual shut-down of multiple organs.
Some 15,700 patients with sepsis are admitted to Australian Intensive Care Units every year. About one in five die. The cost of treating each case is more than $39,000.
“The burden of sepsis is not only in relation to patient outcomes, but also the financial cost to the healthcare system,” Mr Hargovan said.
His project, known as the Cairns Sepsis Model – 4 (CSM- 4) is designed to speed up the assessment of patients within their first four hours in ICU.
The new four-hour mortality prediction model will enable clinicians to detect patients who are at a higher risk of dying, then help to guide their treatment decisions and discussions with the patient and their family.
“Essentially it means that if a patient has a five percent chance of dying, you might treat them less invasively,” he said. “For example, you won’t rush to place them in an induced coma, or insert lines into large arteries or veins.
Mr Hargovan began his research by reviewing more than 50 mortality prediction studies, but soon realized that there was no model in the world specifically designed to predict mortality in adult sepsis patients within four hours of ICU admission.
A case history review of 500 adult sepsis patients admitted to the Cairns Hospital ICU over a four-year period identified 168 factors that could influence patient health outcomes, ranging from age, gender and socio-economic status to type of infection, degree of organ failure, vital signs, blood test results and treatment regimes.
Statistical analysis whittled the figure down to the 10 most significant factors, which include age, history of renal disease, level of consciousness, and abnormal levels of certain substances in the blood that represent varying degrees of organ dysfunction.
The mortality prediction model is inexpensive to use as it largely relies on information easily gleaned from patient history, physical examination, and blood tests that are routinely conducted on patients within their first four hours of admission to an ICU.
The next step involves testing his model on a different and larger set of patients in order to validate his research, before it can be accepted for clinical use.
“Then we’d love to create an online calculator or an app that clinicians can use easily, at the bedside, and have a result within seconds,” he said.
Satyen Hargovan (Mr Hargovan will be available for interviews at the Cairns Hospital).
Associate Professor Alan de Costa. Dr de Costa will be available for interview on Tuesday in Cairns.
What are the potential benefits of using the mortality prediction model developed by Hargovan, and what is the next step in validating and implementing this model in clinical practice?

prompt: Add eggs to these homemade dog cookies! I love this recipe and my 2 boxers, Ben and Emmy, love it more! I am making it weekly because they love it so much. The recipe is fabulous, but needed some tweaks. I doubled the recipe and added 2 eggs, used organic brown rice flour in place of wheat, and substituted 1/2 tsp garlic powder and hot water for the chicken broth. The cookies keep well in the fridge. I made these for my Yorkie/Rat Terrier mix and when they came out of the oven his tail was wagging just from the smell. He LOVES them. What can I substitute for the cheese in this dog treat recipe? I don't feed my dog cheese (let's be honest--it's basically junk food that doesn't belong in an adult dog's diet). Is there anything that you recommend substituting the cheese with? Or can I just leave it out? You could substitute the cheese for an 1/8 cup of ground flax or wheat bran. Is there something else I could use besides oats and wheat flour for this recipe? Chef's Comments ~ That's a great question. You can easily substitute the flour in this and most of our dog treat recipes. A few good grain free flours include almond flour, chickpea flour, potato flour and soy flour. Most of those flours should be available at a major grocery store. As far as substituting the oats, that's a little trickier, but it can be done. The oats are in the recipe for texture and soaking up moisture, so that's what you'll need to replace. First, you will want to halve the amount of oats and add an extra 1/2 cup of flour (or a mixture of the previously mentioned flours). Then you can add a 1/2 cup combination of unsweetened coconut, chopped peanuts and crumbled almond crackers. Or, you could replace all of the oats with the flour mixture. Can I use fresh/raw spinach instead of frozen? If so, does it still need to be microwaved? Chef's Answer ~ That's a great question! :) I haven't tried this recipe with fresh spinach, but I don't see why it couldn't work. If you minced the spinach very fine, my guess is that you would not need to microwave, or otherwise cook, the spinach before adding it to the dog treat dough. Comments for Can I use fresh/raw spinach instead of frozen? Is it necessary to store these cookies in a Refrigerator? Since these are cookies, can it be kept in air tight container outside? And how long would it last if this is done? Chef's Comments ~ You can get lots of tips on How to Store Dog Treats on my website. Unless you live in a very cold climate, most dog treats need to be kept indoors, and even better in the refrigerator. My dogs is algeric to grain. What can I use instead of the whole whear flour? My Husky can't have grain. What can I use besides whole wheat flour. You should put more recipes with no grain in them. Chef's Answer ~ You can replace the wheat flour in most of my dog treat recipes with a non-grain flour. For example, any type of bean flour like Chick Pea (Garbanzo Bean) flour, or "flours" from nuts. They are technically nut meals, but they work as flour, for example almond meal. You should be able to find grain free flours at specialty grocery stores, or at health food stores. Very good simple recipe, however wheat flour isn't something I would normally have in my cupboard. Would it be ok to use plain flour or self raising? Chef's Answer ~ Yes, you can use all purpose flour in place of the whole wheat flour. I do not recommend using self-rising flour because it has the addition of baking powder or baking soda added to it. These are things that homemade dog treats do not need. Can fresh/raw spinach be used in place of frozen spinach in a particular dog treat recipe, and does it need to be cooked beforehand?

prompt:
Can you summarize Onur Unal's career path and main clients as an art director?
Generate according to: Onur Unal is Senior Art Director at Propaganda Advertising Agency in Istanbul.
It all started back in my childhood, I always interested in drawing doodles, reading comics and creating characters. I was inspired by humour magazines, and I was dreaming of become a caricature artist. I took courses on drawing technics, and after graduating from high school, I studied Graphic Design at Marmara University Fine Arts Faculty in Istanbul, Turkey.
During school, I got interested in advertising, and started an internship at Mullen Lowe Istanbul and TBWA Istanbul to practice on creative thinking and art direction. After that, I started to work for Big34, and a year after I accepted for Manajans/JWT. It was the most important years of my career.
I worked on important advertising campaigns of global clients, and won national and international advertising awards as Crystal Apple, Cannes Lions. I’m currently working for Propaganda Advertising Agency, and continue to design creative ideas for our clients.
I work for advertising agencies as an art director since 2009. I work for global and local clients as Nokia, Elidor/Sunsilk, Bosch, Shell, Turkcell, Mazda, Kia, Turkish Airlines, Hyundai, Nestle, Beko, Michelin, BMW, Red Bull, Mitsubishi Electric, Bayer, etc. I work mostly full-time at the office, and these days I also design mobile games with a freelance team.
I learnt that I should keep learning. As the technology and the design trends develop day by day, designers should stay updated. Last year I attended a design week about UX and digital design in London to learn more about digital design principles. During the week, I attended workshops at the design offices, and met designers from all over the world. It was a great experience to compare myself, and now I have new targets for my career.
I always try to find an exciting idea to get inspired. It can be anything – an interesting visual, a strong speech, a good music, anything. To find it, I make a quick research, take some notes and draw sketches. After, I brainstorm with our creative team and we share our ideas. Then the design process starts, I put on my headphones and focus on the design. After designing many alternatives, we make a discussion with our creative team and choose the best one.
The main materials I use are a blank sheet, a pen and creative thinking. All other tools and computer programs help to complete the final process.
Currently I work for Propaganda Advertising Agency. We have a beautiful office at the center of Istanbul with a nice view. I usually go to work around 9:30 am, have my breakfast while reading the news and after that the work begins. I work with a copywriter, and our team lead by a creative director. We usually make meetings at the beginning of the week with our brand executives, and we make a schedule for the deadlines. I usually work until 6:00 – 7:00 pm during the week, but under curtain some circumstances, we work overtimes and also weekends.
As my carreer began, I mostly worked on advertising campaigns, print materials, 360 ideas and digital advertising. Recently, I have been interested in UI, UX and digital design, and want to combine my creative background on advertising with the innovative projects.
During my short study in London last year, I had the chance to work and share my ideas with the designers all over the world, and I discovered things that I had never seen before.
I always believe that a designer should be in contact with all other designers and I want to cross the borders and surround myself with creative people around the world in my own studio.
Learn more about Onur on his website.
